definition: Bad faith in property insurance is a pattern of unreasonable claim handling, misrepresentation, delay, or denial contrary to policy language and applicable law. This is a claims-handling standard, not a criminal designation.

severityLevels.label: Minor Concern
severityLevels.description: Poor communication or small errors, but no clear pattern of unfair conduct.

severityLevels.label: Moderate Concern
severityLevels.description: Unreasonable delays, incomplete investigation, or confusing explanations that may harm the policyholder.

severityLevels.label: High Concern
severityLevels.description: Pattern of unreasonable delays, misstatements, or refusal to consider evidence that significantly disadvantages the policyholder.

eventCategories: Failure to respond within required timeframes
scoringGuidelines: Compare elapsed time against typical or statutory claim deadlines.
Check whether the insurer has provided clear, written explanations.
Consider whether requested documents were already submitted.
Score conservatively and suggest professional review when the situation is complex or serious.
